item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Searchcode.com's SQLite database is probably 6 terabytes bigger than yours (72 points | 24 comments)
2. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (651 points | 219 comments)
3. Twitter blocks links to Signal messenger (257 points | 135 comments)
4. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (95 points | 5 comments)
5. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (344 points | 27 comments)
6. Umami is a simple, fast, privacy-focused alternative to Google Analytics (57 points | 26 comments)
7. Uchū – Color palette for internet lovers (481 points | 192 comments)
8. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (153 points | 18 comments)
9. Tokyo Xtreme Racer Early Access Review: We Are So Back (21 points | 2 comments)
10. A humpback whale briefly swallows kayaker in Chile (3 points | 2 comments)
11. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (149 points | 237 comments)
12. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (203 points | 282 comments)
13. My Time at MIT (41 points | 4 comments)
14. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (122 points | 23 comments)
15. The deadly lottery of the snakebite antivenom industry (26 points | 3 comments)
16. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (308 points | 98 comments)
17. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1516 points | 368 comments)
18. IPv6 Is Hard (194 points | 298 comments)
19. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (44 points | 20 comments)
20. Managers given 200 characters to justify not firing nuclear regulators (51 points | 17 comments)
21. MySQL at Uber (89 points | 27 comments)
22. Hans Bethe Stumbled Upon Perfect Quantum Theories (17 points | 1 comment)
23. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (71 points | 71 comments)
24. Physics Informed Neural Networks (51 points | 1 comment)
25. Gold Is Worth More in New York (82 points | 82 comments)
26. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (89 points | 17 comments)
27. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (215 points | 203 comments)
28. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (114 points | 64 comments)
29. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (107 points | 28 comments)
30. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (271 points | 167 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
